message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we investigate the effects of labor regulations on firm productivity in Latin American and Caribbean countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This report analyzes survey data collected by Gallup Pakistan to identify key drivers of employment outcomes for youth in urban areas.", "dataset": ["Gallup Pakistan"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the causal effect of a policy change in China on soybean imports, we use a difference-in-differences approach with customs transaction-level data and an event study design based on publicly available data from USDA.", "dataset": ["customs transaction-level data", "USDA"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Nigeria General Household Survey Panel, which combines rich household-, plot-, and community-level information.", "dataset": ["Nigeria General Household Survey Panel"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on a global dataset of health systems performance indicators that were measured periodically between 1990 and 2015, along with hand-collected qualitative case studies of health financing reforms from eight low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["global dataset of health systems performance indicators"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper utilizes two sets of data: individual data from the regular waves of the Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES) in Cambodia and enterprise data of formal and informal firms in two provinces.", "dataset": ["Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES)", "enterprise data"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use publicly available microdata from Integrated Household Survey conducted by the Tunisian Statistical Office and identify individuals who own firms from the household registry to construct a matched employer-employee dataset.", "dataset": ["Integrated Household Survey", "household registry"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs variation in the centralization of teacher hiring algorithms, with data from the All-China Education Survey, to investigate how centralizing teacher hiring affects school staffing and student outcomes.", "dataset": ["All-China Education Survey"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We rely on individual-level data from multiple waves of nationally representative surveys to examine association between employment status and self-reported mental health among Indonesian adults.", "dataset": ["nationally representative surveys"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis uses panel data spanning more than two decades from the Population and Housing Census, farm survey data collected by the Thai government, and satellite images.", "dataset": ["Population and Housing Census", "farm survey data", "satellite images"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}]
